questions.question: Claudius asks Rosencrantz & Guildenstern to bring Hamlet to:
Hamlet's "To be or not to be" soliloquy is a debate between:
In Scene 1, Hamlet tells Ophelia to:

choices.answer: Go to France to visit Laertes

questions.question: Before the play begins, Hamlet asks Horatio to:

choices.answer: Play the part of the King
Stop him from killing Claudius during the play
Help him contact the ghost again
Watch Claudius' face for signs of guilt

questions.question: Within the play (The Mousetrap), the King is poisoned by his nephew named:
In Scene 3, why does Hamlet choose not to kill Claudius?

choices.answer: He waits too long & hears people coming
Killing him during prayer might send him to heaven
He's too much of a coward

questions.question: During Scene 4, why does Gertrude cry out after Hamlet storms into her room?

choices.answer: She is startled by a rat
She sees the Ghost of King Hamlet

questions.question: In Scene 4, whenHamlet strikes his sword through the curtain, he assumes he is killing:
The characteristics of Polonius that have most directly led to his death are:

choices.answer: His inability to make logical decisions

questions.question: In the bedroom scene, Hamlet forces Gertrude to look at two pictures of:
The Ghost appears in Scene 4 to:

choices.answer: Tell Hamlet to be kinder to his mother
Make Hamlet appear even more insane
Warn Hamlet that Claudius is trying to kill him

questions.question: During Scene 4, Gertrude agrees to keep this secret from Claudius:

choices.answer: That she knows Claudius killed King Hamlet
That Hamlet is pretending to be crazy
That Hamlet is going back to school

questions.question: At the end of the bedroom scene, Hamlet asks his mother:

choices.answer: Not to allow Claudius to send him to England
Not to go to Claudius’ bed that night
Not to tell Laertes who killed Polonius
Not to tell Claudius that he killed Polonius

questions.question: What does Hamlet take with him as he leaves his mother's room?

choices.answer: A locket with a photo of his father inside

questions.question: Which sentence best explains the sequence of events in Scene 4?

choices.answer: Hamlet confronts his mother & then kills Polonius
Hamlet tries to kill Gertrude & Polonius dies defending her
Hamlet finds Polonius behind the curtain & kills him
Hamlet kills the king first & then Polonius
